title: Wonhyeok Choi
text:
Wonhyeok Choi is an undergraduate Statistics & Data Science student at UCLA who loves turning complex data into clear insights. When he’s not building models or exploring new analytics tools, he enjoys soccer, biostatistics and working on sports analytics side projects.

title: Wonhyeok Choi
text:
U.S. Pandemic Travel Behavior Study
Led data analysis for The Data Voyage, a study on U.S. travel patterns during and after COVID-19 using the “Trips by Distance” dataset. Produced Tableau dashboards, narrative integration, and visual storytelling to explain shifting mobility trends.
Here is my project 1 link

title: Wonhyeok Choi
text:
Project 2
Statistical Experimental Design Project — Effect of Alcohol & Music on Openness
Statistical Experimental Design Project — Effect of Alcohol & Music on Openness Designed and executed a 3×3 factorial experiment (198 participants) to test whether drink type (beer, tequila, vodka) and music genre (classical, country, dance) produce measurable short-term changes in the Big Five trait Openness. Included blocking for age, gender, and BMI and analyzed effects using two-way ANOVA.
Here is my project 2 link

title: Wonhyeok Choi
text:
Project 3
U.S. County-Level Election Classification with Machine Learning
Used county-level socioeconomic and demographic data to predict the 2020 U.S. presidential county winner (Biden vs. Trump). Built and tuned multiple machine learning models—including Random Forest, XGBoost, and Gradient Boosting—and achieved 0.937 private leaderboard accuracy with a tuned Random Forest.
Here is my project 3 link
